oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Invoice of public property in possession of the Quartermaster in the District of East Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; United States -- Army -- Quartermaster Corps
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: List of thirty-nine line items including fifty pontoons, two stoves, fifteen blacksmiths bellows, and three portable forges, all of which are considered more economical to sell than to transport to other points. The invoice is made in accordance with General Order No. 113.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Quartermaster's Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: William Alonzo Wainwright, United States Assistant Quartermaster's Records, 1861-1870
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Quartermaster of the Army provides logistical support to the combat troops in the form of ammunition, clothing, food, and pay.
